activities.title: pigments workshop
activities.description: An intuitive exploration into the material properties of pigments

activities.title: fugitives of the second dimension
activities.description: How do we accurately represent the three dimensionality in two dimensional media?

activities.description: Making better visualizations of data for the public good

title: imagined objects
fictional objects
activities.description: Making better visualizations of data for the public good

activities.title: breakout - art study center visit - chinese bronzes
activities.description: Close looking at the aura of materiality and production in Chinese bronzes

activities.title: breakout - art study center visit - american photographers
activities.description: One day exhibition of photographs, in various stages of production, from the American Professional Photographers Collection

activities.title: breakout - art study center visit - back of paintings
activities.description: A viewing of the back of paintings in the Harvard Art Museums' collections for clues of provenance and other metadata
objectives: To understand the intersection of materiality and metadata

activities.title: harvard art museums tour
activities.description: Participants went to the Harvard Art Museums for a tour of the gallery collections

activities.title: turning off the rothkos
activities.description: Participants discussed ephemeral forms of conservation used in the restored Harvard murals, and the implications they have for the object and art theory
objectives: To grasp the materiality of the object
To see the intersection of new media and art theory

activities.title: nametags as introductions
activities.description: Participants wrote three words to describe their problem collections

activities.title: breakout session - jeffrey schnapp
activities.description: Jeffrey Schnapp described his work exploring new forms of curation that engage with media and surrogates

activities.title: breakout session - rothkos
activities.description: Sherri and Tim discussed the Rothko restoration at Harvard
objectives: To understand conservation with ephemeral materials

activities.title: decorva sculpture park
activities.description: Participants went to the deCorva sculpture park in Lincoln, Mass. to explore the three-dimensionality of objects, and how this translates into surrogates and resulting metadata

readings.description: database is a correlate to narrative in new media

collections.title: King Tutankhamun's Textiles
collections.description: A collection of King Tut's textiles. Presents issues around preservation and presentation.

tools.creator: Density Design
tools.title: Raw
tools.description: Raw takes (moderate sized) csv files and allows you to customize a diverse set of predefined visualizations. Very pretty and fairly intuitive.

questions.title: How might we use data and media to uncover unexpected relationships between objects and social issues?
How might we create a tool making it easy to use and analyze link-open-data collections -- getting beyond museum walls? ie. audience of museum professionals, teen classes, etc.
How might we create a transcendent/interactive experience for computer technologies?
How might museums design immersive environments that provide realistic contextual information for objects with very little metadata?
How might we create a software for art visitors that aggregates existing and new (from the visitor) metadata?
How might we convey/translate sensory information into a database?
How might we make data emotional?
How might a museum encourage adults to engage in digital/material playtime?
How might we communicate the museum’s collections to a non-human as a provocation?
How might we make our own path?
How might we create an interactive visual argument troubling the border between quantitative and qualitative research?
How might we enable critical exploration of institutional discourses embedded in metadata?

prototypes.title: Code From Corbu
prototypes.description: Code from Corbu is a site-responsive installation in which six very different collections, or datasets, collide

prototypes.title: Copy That
prototypes.description: This website promotes transparency andcopyright literacy by translating conditions of access to public domain items, images, and data.

prototypes.title: Contextual Engagement: Telling the Rich Stories Inside King Tutankhamen’s Tomb
prototypes.description: This project sketches the description and enactment of invisible, lost spatial relations among funerary objects in the tomb of King Tut

prototypes.title: The Qualitative/Quantitative Duality: A Humanities Provocation
prototypes.description: Our project webpage presents experimental visualizations to suggest the the interleaved, fractal-like nature of quantitative assumptions and arguments built into seemingly qualitative humanities research.

prototypes.title: Touch and Collect
prototypes.description: A short video clip will show a visitor collecting and manipulating tactile beads that replicate the materials used in each artwork.

prototypes.title: Camera Lucida
prototypes.description: a custom projection apparatus and unique engagement prompts that encourage visitors to reflect upon and respond to works of art

prototypes.title: Linked Open Data: Putting it to Use
prototypes.description: An exploration of how tools might make linked open data more accessible to museum professionals

prototypes.title: OMG Cats
prototypes.description: An exploration of tags, and tag subgroups from images on instagram

prototypes.title: Playing The Race Card
prototypes.description: An exploration of how tools might make linked open data more accessible to museum professionals

prototypes.title: Let Me Think About This For A Couple Of Seconds.
prototypes.description: An exploration of how tools might make linked open data more accessible to museum professionals

precedents.title: Cooper Hewitt Pen
precedents.description: a pen for visitors to 'collect' and interact with art they like

precedents.title: iknowwhereyourcatlives.com
precedents.description: a website to locate cats tagged on instagram

precedents.title: Like Tinder For Cats
